attributes.contentHtml:
skid
[skɪd]
VERB
(of a vehicle) slide, typically sideways or obliquely, on slippery ground or as a result of stopping or turning too quickly.
"her car skidded and hit the grass verge" · [More]
synonyms:
glide · move lightly · slide · sail · plane · scud · skate · float · coast · aquaplane
fasten a skid to (a wheel) as a brake.
NOUN
an act of skidding or sliding.
"the Volvo went into a skid"
synonyms:
fit of rage · rage · fury · fit of bad/ill temper · bad temper · tantrum · passion · paroxysm · fit of pique · bad mood · mood · pet · sulk · mard · paddywhack · miff
